arg.name: context
arg.help:
CONTEXT: The extent (in characters) of the text or other content immediately surrounding the located word/phrase/object. By default this is either +- 100 characters (Publisher limit) or to the end of the object (paragraph). a single "characterExtent" field gives +- characterExtent (post == pre), while "characterExtent "characterExtent2" gives the preceeding and following text.
Note: --context must come before any arguments which may depend on its value (e.g. regex)

arg.name: param
arg.help: PARAM A simple method (primarily for demo and learning) that passes a number of strings to the application. The strings are parsed by "parseParam()" which should be overridden in the application. The application consists of subclasses of SimpleVisitor and SimpleSearcher

arg.name: update
arg.help: UPDATE If an existing results file exists choose the option for updating: "merge" is not yet supported and will throw an Exception "none" will throw an exception "overwrite" will overwrite

arg.name: xpath
arg.help: XPATH Defines the section/s of the document to analyze. The argument is one or more xpath strings separated by spaces. (The xpaths cannot contain spaces currently.)

arg.name: lookup
arg.help: Looks up results in online sites. This can be overridden for specialist plugins. may be called at ResultElement creation or might be deferred to final.

arg.name: test
arg.help: A dummy parameter to test conformance
